title: KHR_materials_volume glTF extension
description: glTF extension that defines the parameters for the volume of a material.

thinWalled.gltf_detailedDescription: The material describes either a two-sided surface enclosing an infinitely thin volume (true, the default) or a one-sided surface with a volume below it, defined by the mesh geometry (false).

attenuationCoefficient.description: The attenuation coefficient in inverse scene units.

thicknessTexture.description: A texture that defines the thickness of the volume beneath the surface in the G channel.
thicknessTexture.gltf_detailedDescription: A texture that defines the thickness of the volume beneath the surface. The values are sampled from the G channel. May be used by renderers that are not able to derive the thickness from the actual geometry, otherwise it should be ignored.

minThickness.description: Minimum thickness of the volume, corresponds to a texture value of 0.0.
minThickness.gltf_detailedDescription: When using a thickness texture, a texture value of 0.0 is interpreted to be minThickness. When a constant thickness is used, the thickness will be minThickness.

maxThickness.description: Maximum thickness of the volume, corresponds to a texture value of 1.0.
maxThickness.gltf_detailedDescription: When using a thickness texture, a texture value of 1.0 is interpreted to be maxThickness. Values between 0.0 and 1.0 are linearly scaled between minThickness and maxThickness.
